column5: Hello! Curious as to if any Resorts up in Canada frequent the site. Have reached a point in my life where I could take some time, and do something a really enjoy for awhile. If anyone knows of a Resort/Lodge looking for some FT/PT help this spring/summer, let me know! I'd love to head up there for a few months this coming summer and guide, clean fish, mow, ect. You'd have a hard time finding anyone who would be happier than I to do such tasks! Thank You! Ryan[email protected]
If you aren't a Canadian citizen you might be hard pressed to obtain a work permit. If you don't have the permit, Immigration can get nasty!

It would probably be a hassle to get a permit to work up here, but that's not to say that there aren't a bunch of lodges that might pay you under the table for a month or two anyways. Just start e-mailing, and you should find somthing.

HEY, why not guide down there ? Why come up here & take work away from a citizen of Canada ? I guide up here & I can tell you that there sometimes isn't enough work for all of us. I can't come down to your country to work, so why should you be allowed to work in my country ?
come on down ! stay awhile ! and if ya vote for me I'll make you and 8 million of your cousins US citizens - but ya gotta vote for me. Bush in 04. what a bunch of crap
LMAO!!! There's always one in the crowd! Thanks for the humor, made me smile........ and then burst into laughter, on what would normally be a hum drum morning! Thanks again! Ryan

Bullhead: You can check out the following web site for information about temporarily working in Canada:http://www.cic.gc.ca/english/work/index.html Quite a few Northern Ontario outfitters frequent the following web site. You might consider posting there for some responses.http://www.justfishontario.com/
